qas.question: Is the view of the impregnation of Mary's pregnancy the same as the one held for the birth of her first child ?

answers.text: doctrine of the immaculate conception (Mary being conceived free from original sin) is not to be confused with her virginal conception of her son Jesus

qas.question: What is the view held at the Vatican regarding how Mary was actually given life into the world ?

answers.text: Catholics believe that Mary was not the product of a virginal conception herself but was the daughter of a human father and mother

qas.question: Who were the parents of Mary believed to be ?
When were contradictory views to  the belief of Mary's parentage struck down ?

answers.text: 1677, the Holy See condemned the belief that Mary was virginally conceived,

qas.question: When did these contradictory views start to emerge ?

plausible_answers.text: her virginal conception of her son Jesus

qas.question: What other event is the immaculate conception similar to?
Who often makes a distinction between the conception of Jesus in the conception of Mary?
Who believes that Mary is a product of a virginal conception?
Who upheld the belief that Mary was virtually conceived in 1677?
On what date is the virginal conception of Mary celebrated?

context: The <a0_0>doctrine of the immaculate conception (Mary being conceived free from original sin) is not to be confused with <b5_0>her virginal conception of her son Jesus<b5_0/><a0_0/>. This misunderstanding of the term immaculate conception is frequently met in <b6_0>the mass media<b6_0/>. <a1_0><b7_0>Catholics<b7_0/> believe that Mary was not the product of a virginal conception herself but was the daughter of a human father and mother<a1_0/>, traditionally known by the names of <a2_0>Saint Joachim and Saint Anne<a2_0/>. In <a3_0>1677, <b8_0>the Holy See<b8_0/> condemned the belief that Mary was virginally conceived,<a3_0/> which had been a belief surfacing occasionally <a4_0>since the 4th century<a4_0/>. The Church celebrates the Feast of the Immaculate Conception (when Mary was conceived free from original sin) on <b9_0>8 December,<b9_0/> exactly nine months before celebrating the Nativity of Mary. The feast of the Annunciation (which commemorates the virginal conception and the Incarnation of Jesus) is celebrated on 25 March, nine months before Christmas Day.
